Keywords: max-width, container, content width, center, wrapper
Description: All page content must be contained within a consistent max-width container, centered horizontally.
Do: Use max-w-7xl (1280px) or max-w-6xl (1152px) consistently across all sections. Center with mx-auto. Add horizontal padding px-4 sm:px-6 lg:px-8.
Don't: Don't mix different max-widths across sections (max-w-5xl in hero, max-w-7xl in features). Don't forget horizontal padding on mobile.

Keywords: full bleed, full width, edge to edge, background extend
Description: Some sections need full-width backgrounds (hero, CTA, footer) while keeping content contained within max-width.
Do: Use full-width wrapper for background, nested max-width container for content. Background extends edge-to-edge, content stays contained.
Don't: Don't make content full-width (unreadable on large screens). Don't forget the inner container.
Code Example Good: contained content
Code Example Bad: <section class="bg-gray-900 py-24 px-4">content stretches full width on 4K screens</section>

Keywords: section padding, vertical spacing, section gap, py
Description: Consistent vertical padding between page sections creates visual rhythm and readability.
Do: Use py-16 (64px) for mobile, md:py-24 (96px) for desktop as base section spacing. Use py-20 md:py-32 for hero sections. Keep consistent across all sections.
Don't: Don't use different paddings for each section. Don't use less than py-12 (48px) for any section. Don't use margins between sections (use padding inside).
Code Example Good: <section class="py-16 md:py-24">Features section</section><section class="py-16 md:py-24">Testimonials section</section>
Code Example Bad: <section class="py-8">Features</section><section class="py-20">Testimonials</section> <!-- Inconsistent spacing -->

Keywords: spacing scale, gap, margin, padding, 4px grid
Description: All spacing values must follow a consistent scale based on 4px (0.25rem) increments.
Do: Use Tailwind spacing scale: 1(4px) 2(8px) 3(12px) 4(16px) 6(24px) 8(32px) 10(40px) 12(48px) 16(64px) 20(80px) 24(96px). Use gap for flex/grid children.
Don't: Don't use arbitrary values (margin: 13px, padding: 7px). Don't mix rem and px. Don't use negative margins for layout (use gap instead).

Keywords: z-index, stacking, layer, overlay, z
Description: Standardized z-index values prevent stacking context conflicts. Define a clear scale.
Do: z-10: Sticky elements (cards, badges). z-20: Dropdowns, tooltips. z-30: Fixed sidebar. z-40: Mobile menu overlay. z-50: Navbar. z-[60]: Modal backdrop. z-[70]: Modal content. z-[80]: Toast/notification. z-[90]: Tooltip over modal. z-[100]: Skip link.
Don't: Don't use arbitrary z-index values (z-[9999]). Don't compete with z-indexes (navbar z-50 vs modal z-50). Don't forget z-index only works on positioned elements.

Keywords: grid, columns, layout grid, css grid, flex grid
Description: Use CSS Grid or Flexbox for page layouts. Standard 12-column grid for complex layouts, flex for simple ones.
Do: Use grid grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-2 lg:grid-cols-3 for card layouts. Use grid-cols-12 for complex layouts with col-span-*. Use gap-6 or gap-8 between grid items.
Don't: Don't use float for layouts. Don't manually calculate widths (width: 33.33%). Don't forget responsive columns (single column on mobile).

Keywords: floating nav, navbar spacing, nav offset, content offset
Description: Floating navbar (fixed position with margin from edges) requires content offset to prevent overlap.
Do: Add pt-24 or pt-28 to main content container when using floating navbar. Navbar uses top-4 left-4 right-4 with rounded corners. Calculate offset = navbar height + top margin + extra spacing.
Don't: Don't use top-0 left-0 right-0 for floating navbar (use top-4 left-4 right-4). Don't forget content offset (content hides behind navbar). Don't make offset too small (content touches navbar).
Code Example Good: <nav class="fixed top-4 left-4 right-4 z-50 h-16 bg-white/80 backdrop-blur rounded-2xl">nav</nav><main class="pt-28">content starts below navbar</main>
Code Example Bad: <nav class="fixed top-0 z-50 h-16">nav</nav><main>content hidden behind navbar</main>

Don't: Don't make sidebar scrollable with page. Don't use percentage width for sidebar. Don't forget mobile layout (sidebar becomes overlay or hidden).

Keywords: sticky footer, footer bottom, min height, page footer
Description: Footer must always appear at the bottom of the viewport even when content is short (not fixed, just pushed down).
Do: Use min-h-screen on page wrapper with flex flex-col. Footer gets mt-auto. OR use grid with grid-rows-[auto_1fr_auto] on body/wrapper.
Don't: Don't use fixed positioning for footer (covers content). Don't use absolute bottom-0 (overlaps content). Don't rely on enough content to push footer down.

Keywords: readable width, text width, prose, line length, max chars
Description: Body text content (blog posts, articles, long-form) should be constrained for readability (65-75 chars per line).
Do: Use max-w-prose (65ch) or max-w-3xl for text-heavy content. Center with mx-auto. Works within larger grid layouts. Use Tailwind prose class for articles.
Don't: Don't let text span full max-w-7xl container (too wide to read). Don't constrain non-text content (cards, grids) with prose width. Don't use max-w-prose for dashboard layouts.

Keywords: page transition, route animation, navigation animation, view transition
Description: Smooth transitions between page navigations enhance perceived performance and UX.
Do: Use CSS View Transitions API or Framer Motion page transitions. Fade-in for new content (opacity 0 to 1, 200-300ms). Use layout animations for shared elements.
Don't: Don't use slow transitions (>500ms) that delay content. Don't animate every element (just page container). Don't use slide animations for unrelated pages.
Code Example Good: <main class="animate-in fade-in duration-300">page content</main> /* Or View Transitions API: ::view-transition-old(root) { animation: fade-out 200ms; } */
Code Example Bad: <main style="animation: slideInFromLeft 1s">every page slides from left, even unrelated pages</main>

Keywords: heading hierarchy, h1 h2 h3, heading levels, semantic headings
Description: Pages must use a proper heading hierarchy (H1 → H2 → H3). Never skip levels. One H1 per page.
Do: Exactly one H1 per page (main page title). H2 for major sections. H3 for sub-sections. Never skip from H1 to H3. Size: H1 text-4xl/5xl, H2 text-2xl/3xl, H3 text-xl/2xl.
Don't: Don't use multiple H1s. Don't skip heading levels (H1 → H3). Don't use headings for visual styling only (use font-size classes instead). Don't use H5/H6 (usually means too-deep nesting).

Keywords: form layout, form structure, input layout, form design
Description: Forms should be well-structured with proper spacing, labels, and visual hierarchy.
Do: Stack form fields vertically with space-y-4 or space-y-6. Use labels above inputs. Group related fields. Full-width inputs on mobile. 2-column for short fields on desktop (name, city).
Don't: Don't use inline labels on the left (hard to scan). Don't pack too many fields in one row. Don't forget error message space below inputs.
Code Example Bad: <form><label>Email</label><input /><label>Name</label><input /> <!-- No spacing, no structure -->

Keywords: modal, dialog, overlay, popup, lightbox
Description: Modals overlay content with a backdrop. Must be accessible, dismissible, and properly positioned.
Do: Center modal vertically and horizontally. Use backdrop (bg-black/50). Close on backdrop click + Escape key. Trap focus inside modal. Max-width based on content type (sm for confirm, lg for form).
Don't: Don't use modals for long content (use a page instead). Don't stack modals. Don't auto-open modals on page load (except critical alerts). Don't forget focus trap.

Code Example Bad: modal without backdrop, not centered, no close

Keywords: toast, notification, snackbar, alert, message
Description: Toast notifications appear temporarily to provide feedback. Consistent positioning across the app.
Do: Position: fixed top-4 right-4 or bottom-4 right-4. Z-index: z-[80] (above modals). Auto-dismiss after 3-5 seconds. Stack multiple toasts vertically. Include dismiss button.
Don't: Don't position toasts behind modals. Don't use center-screen toasts (blocks interaction). Don't make toasts persistent without dismiss option. Don't show more than 3 toasts at once.

Keywords: responsive image, image sizing, aspect ratio, image container
Description: Images must be responsive, maintain aspect ratio, and not cause layout shift.
Do: Use aspect-ratio or aspect-video/aspect-square classes. Set width and height attributes on img tags. Use object-cover for cropped images. Use next/image for Next.js (automatic optimization).
Don't: Don't use fixed pixel widths on images. Don't forget width/height attributes (causes CLS). Don't stretch images (use object-cover or object-contain). Don't load full-size images on mobile.
